DOC.detailed_description: Patients acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) increase risk acute kidney injury ( AKI ) undergo urgent/emergency coronary angiography . The optimal medical treatment prevent occurrence contrast induce - acute kidney injury still controversial . Fenoldopam mesylate dopamine A1 receptor agonist augments renal plasma flow reduce risk radiocontrast dye nephropathy ( ) preliminary study . Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( NGAL ) new biomarker predictive AKI already show useful early diagnosis contrast induce nephropathy . The primary objective study test hypothesis fenoldopam , addition standard treatment , reduce occurrence contrast induce - acute kidney injury patient acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) undergo urgent/emergency coronary angiography and/or percutaneous coronary intervention . Patients randomized standard i.v . 1 ml/kg/h saline infusion ( Gr . A , N= 50 ) combination i.v . 1 ml/kg/h saline infusion fenoldopam administration ( 0.08 mcg/Kg/min ) 6 hour procedure 12 hour procedure . Primary End-points • Incidence contrast induce acute kidney injury Secondary End-points • Post-angiographic 48-h absolute increase creatinine , absolute increase estimate glomerular filtration rate , Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( NGAL ) value
DOC.criteria: Indication urgent/emergency coronary angiography Normal renal function ( eGFR > 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 ) Moderate high Mehran 's risk score CIN ( > 11 ) . Able understand willing sign inform CF • Women child bear potential patient must demonstrate negative pregnancy test perform within 24 hour CT
